features: The purest taste: Made with the finest quality borosilicate glass which resists scratching and scuffing, no plastics touch the boiling water inside including the lid, unlike other kettles use plastic for the inner lid(the filter is made of stainless steel and 100% BPA-free plastic)

Safe tech & auto shut off: Features British STRIX thermostat technology, auto shut-off within 30s after the water is fully boiling. Boil-dry safety feature where it turns off if it detects there is no water inside
Blue LED indicator: know that your kettle is in the process of boiling when the light is on, light ring concealed inside the glass is safe and durable
Quick boil: water heats up quickly in 3-7mins, a great choice to replace your microwave, stove or your old kettle. Perfect match for Coffee, tea, oatmeal, pasta and much more

Great addition to your kitchen: simple design looks lovely on your counter while the blue LED light is on. Completely cordless when off the base, The kettle rotates 360º for precise measuring of water for convenient pouring and serving

Wide mouth & easy to clean: a wide mouth means both easy cleaning and filling, it allows for easy access to clean those deposits or "rust" Away. Refer the descale instruction in our video tutorials under the "related video shorts" Section named "how to descale your Cosori Electric Kettle"
2-Year for free: FDA compliant/ ETL listed/cetl listed, 120V, 60Hz. 90-Day money-back, also 2-year purchase and lifetime support from Cosori

productDescription:
From the manufacturer
Inside and Out
Strix Temperature Tech
The best kettle technology out there is used to offer dry-run (boil-dry) protection and auto shut-off.
Quick Boil
Save precious minutes boiling water in the kettle instead of on the stove. Even use kettle-boiled water to supplement whatever’s simmering stovetop.
Durable Materials
A minimalist and stylish design is outfitted with food-grade stainless steel and glass. Safe to use—and elegant to have around.
Great Gift Choice
Come with a blue gift box, gift-ready for all the holiday!
Easy to Use



Fill it up with water!
Maximum capacity: 1.7 L
Press Down
One push gets the boil started. The indicator light will glow during boil.
Drink Up
Auto shutoff within 30 seconds once the water has reached a boil.
Clean Details



Wide-Mouth Opening
Easily reach the inside of the kettle through its opening to wipe down or wash the glass with a rag or sponge.
Stainless Steel Filter
Water goes through an extra stainless steel filter at the spout.
Sturdy Handle
Get a good grip on your kettle and pour yourself some hot water!

reviews.reviewText: We purchased this Cosori, 1.7L, Cordless, Glass Hot Water Heater seven weeks ago and can offer the following review after using this Cosori unit at least twice a day for these past seven weeks.,  We have found this Cosori unit to be very easy to use.  We fill the carafe with the desired liquid volume,  place the glass carafe onto the heating unit, and activate the Start switch to begin the short heating process.  Most of our liquid heating requests are for the maximum volume -- 1.7L.  The heating time from the Start request to full boil is less than five minutes.  I have measured the water temperature at full boil with an infrared heat measuring instrument.  The recorded temperature has been 212 degrees Fahrenheit - consistently.  The blue LED light does illuminate when electrical power is being employed to function the unit.  The blue LED light shuts off when the heating function ceases., " Cleaning procedures are clearly described in the enclosed owners manual/instructions.  We use a clean cloth to wipe down the exterior of the unit as well as the interior of the carafe.  I have found the carafes opening quite large enough to easily perform any wipe-down of the carafes interior walls or stainless steel bottom.  To that end, its a considerate design element that the lid-affixed liquid strainer has some flexibility so that any inadvertent bump to the strainer while cleaning the carafes interior, will help prevent any permanent damage to the strainer or lid.",  Pouring boiling liquid from the carafe into a cup or other receptacle has been easy and safe. Neither one of us have found the weight of a full carafe to be an issue.,  The electrical heating plate, on which the glass carafe rests, does accept a few wraps (on the underside of the electrical plate) of the electrical cord should cord length be a concern.  It has not been so for us.,  Yes.  We have caused the glass carafe to lightly "clunk" against the sink faucet, sink, counter top.  No scratching or fractures have occurred to the glass.,  De-scaling cleaning process/instructions  -  we have amended only the following:  Two cups of distilled vinegar to one cup of water.,  Based on our seven weeks of use and communication with Cosori representatives, we would recommend this Amazon seller for honesty and integrity and this unit for dependable function.

"Folks, if youre looking for a plastic free kettle this lovely looking item is NOT the one for you.  There is absolutely a plastic ring INSIDE the kettle around the stainless steel heating element on the bottom.  Those of you who are saying in your reviews that there is no plastic, sorry to burst your plastic free bubble.  Hard to see, but take a knife and gently poke the space between the heating element and the glass wall of the unit.  You will feel the very soft gummy plastic.  I dont know, maybe its silicon.  But I dont love that either, mine is going back.", "Its two weeks later and I want to make an amendment to my review. I think I was harsh. I had read so many questions and answers and reviews saying there was no plastic and then when I received it I was very disappointed because there is plastic. Or silicon, to me its the same thing. But if you dont mind the plastic, it is a very lovely item and I have to say that customer service was top-notch. They saw my unhappy review and immediately contacted me and offered me an alternative product. So I decided to try it, its a stainless steel Kettle and even though I wanted glass I have not been able to find any glass kettle with zero plastic in it. The stainless steel kettle is lovely."

"\xa0I really love this electric kettle! Love the shape. It is easy to clean, comes to a full boil quickly, and it is attractive. :-) Lets face it, using this electric kettle to boil water is much better for the environment than heating it up on a stove. (and your utility bill!)", "It is well made and sturdy. I am sure will withstand the test of time. Cant say enough about the blue light in it, (thats the little kid in me).", Cosori uses the British Strix thermostat technology, which some companies do not, and I found this important in my decision., As other customers, I did a lot of research before purchasing. Cosori has a lot of support and it is well deserved! If you have an issue, or even a suggestion/comment, they are willing to listen, something most companies are not willing to do., Thank you Jubilee for being so patient and taking the time to listen! Hope the product designers will consider what we discussed regarding the LED light color. Will not reiterate here as it would not be good for your competitors to steal your design idea!, Okay, now for the purest out there. Yes, unfortunately you will notice some odor from the pouring spout which is mainly stainless steel, however the edges are plastic., "It would be excellent if the product designers, (geniuses that they are), could make the pouring spout all metal. The plastic surrounding the mesh does indeed touch the glass container when the lid is down and boiling water does splash up and touch it too. However, I am confident that with a little ingenuity, the product designers can change this. That change would make this kettle from Cosori even more attractive to those who dont want any type of plastic to touch their water.", All in all, bottom line. Yes, it is a wonderful kettle. Yes, I would highly recommend it. Yes, it is very attractive. Yes, in the future if needed, I will purchase this again or buy it as a gift for family and friends. Great job Cosori! Thank you!
"A strong plastic smell.  Were still searching for a kettle that doesnt have plastic in contact with the water or the steam.  Want glass with stainless steel."
Developed rust spots and now scared to use it.  Seeking refund.
It is pretty and  it works well so far. I put only 4 stars because the filter in the spout has a piece of black plastic, I would like it to have none, only stainless steel in contact with the water.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed by quality of product after first use
reviews.reviewText: After only one use, spots appeared on the bottom of the kettle that will not wash off.

reviews.reviewTitle: silicone ring at bottom of the kettle
reviews.reviewText: "So like some I thought this might be all glass. I even checked with Cosori and they said its all glass. I get the kettle, and like others check the ring at the bottom - it is indeed a silicone ring around the heat-plate. This comes in direct contact with any water that goes in the kettle. Now this is supposedly a food grade silicone ring (same stuff that goes into baby bottles). Safe, etc... However, Im concerned they didnt tell me the truth (or know the truth upfront). This makes me question what the ring is really made out of. Also there are still studies out there saying silicone may or may not be bad for you.  Long story short - pretty kettle, works well but the ring is kind of a deal breaker.", "Update: I spoke with the Corsori customer service and they were more than helpful. They provided an alternative kettle that doesnt have the silicone. Very nice of them to do this. I bumped up the review to 4/5 stars based on this excellent customer service. They also have updated the description of this glass kettle to mention it does have a silicone seal at the bottom (which is food/baby friendly)."

reviews.reviewTitle: took more than 1.5 min. to auto shut off once it came to a roiling boil
reviews.reviewText: This is advertised to auto shut off once it comes to a full roiling boil. I tested it twice, new out of the box, and following instructions, and both times it took over 1.5 minutes to auto turn off. I returned it.

"4.3 stars. Quite convenient. I use it sometimes to just barely warm water (in which case the 500 ml minimum isnt as important). The cycle is clean w/no heated plastic, and it beats needing to turn on a stove burner 5 min. just for the element to heat up. Slightly cumbersome pouring the water out of the pitcher, so might want to guide with the opposite hand on the base below the warmed glass body."
Bought this.  Excited to try.  First two uses went fine.  Third use, the lid won’t close anymore. Pretty bad quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: The kettle broke within a week.
reviews.reviewText: The kettle broke within a week of usage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent look; prone to poisoning customers. Avoid if health is important to you.
reviews.reviewText: "I purchased this about a month ago. It looks great, boils semi-quickly, and is very easy to wash. However, after about 3 weeks, I started noticing black specks in the water. There is a rubber element near the top of the glass container that was beginning to deteriorate due to the high temperatures, into the water. So, naturally, I removed it. And after removing it, the boiled water tastes like plastic. Its unmistakable. Ive never owned a product with so much contamination, so quickly. I would happily rate this 5 stars if it wasnt prone to poisoning the customer. Honestly, this seems to be the product class action lawsuits are made of."

I did my homework before I ordered this kettle. I checked reviews from other sites, checked at least 12 different products on Amazon, and read so many reviews about those products., I am so glad I ordered this kettle because;, 1. The inside lid is made of stainless steel., 2. This kettle is very stylish., 3. This kettle boils water VERY quickly., 4. Cleaning is very easy.

"After boiling water and as pouring into a cup, water drips from the spout and it does not go into the cup.  Each time I heat water, the heating element is wet and water appears to be leaking from the bottom of the kettle.  I cannot see where its coming from.  Not sure Id order this brand, again."
"When I received it, the plastic was wet which means that it was USED one! and the lid didnt close at all!  also, the filter part  was missing. It was a totally a used one with the terrible smell."

reviews.reviewTitle: 40 cycles in one month and the glass cracked.
reviews.reviewText: Loved it until it cracked at about the 40th cycle.  Two weeks of use, 2-3 times per day., I bought this instead of buying a hot shot, a product I grew up with., It looks cool from a design perspective with the blue glow and boiling water, but when reading reviews, I saw another one that had cracked so I left it in the box until I needed it after oral surgery., I figured that the cracked one was just because of misuse and kept it until I really needed it., I never once stayed in my kitchen while it was boiling.  I always stepped out.  I never forgot seeing that image of cracked glass., Last night I spotted a small crack.  I felt the outside of the glass and it was smooth so I used it again., Today, the first use following seeing the crack, the crack got longer.  This time I realized that it really was serious since it had grown in length., Something about this, in the back of my head had kept me from using it and I should have listened to that inner voice., My kitchen stays cool as I rarely keep the heat on in there and having water boil at a rolling boil that you can see just never sat well with me due to changes in temperature., "That said, the past two weeks, the weather, and my kitchen, have both been mild in temperature... in the 60s.", "I see they make a product that isnt glass, by the way.", "I dont know what the solution is here, as I dont know glass.  But I wont continue to use it."

reviews.reviewTitle: A beautiful and functional addition to any kitchen
reviews.reviewText: I was looking to replace another 7-year old glass kettle that was operational, but began to fall apart.  My Manhattan kitchen is open and visible to the living room.  Thus, aesthetics, as well as durability and ease of use are important.  To me glass presented the most most attractive appearance.  I searched online for weeks, reading reviews and looking at scores of kettles, finally settling on the Cosori., After purchasing it, but before it arrived, I received descaling instructions from the manufacturer.  To me this seemed like more work than I wanted for the simple process of heating water for tea.  I decided to return the kettle when it arrived.  Yet I hesitated for a few days, because the photo on the box was so attractive.  The manufacture sent another email requesting a review, and I replied about my concerns.  They immediately responded with instructions and a video, encouraging me to give it a try, but making it clear that returning it would be no problem if my concerns were not allayed., "Well, out of the packaging, the kettle was even more beautiful than in the photo.  It quickly heated a full liter of water.  There was some smell of plastic.  I followed the manufacturers advice in their email to use either lemon or vinegar with water to address it.  Problem solved!  After testing it by refilling it continuously and boiling water numerous times, there was some small spotting in the bottom of the pot on the metal.  Using a soft plastic scrubber with dish soap, it removed easily in seconds.  Cleaning it was simple because of the large opening at the top.", "Yes, there is a small amount of plastic in the filter of the lid.  However, it is BPA-free.  This doesnt deter me.  Ive done sufficient research and testing.  I now intend to enjoy my Cosori kettle."
"Ive had several hot water devices over the years.  This one is by far the most efficient and the simple design looks lovely on my countertop!"

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful kettle for who loves tea and warm water
reviews.reviewText: The kettle looks very nice, we love it. I even noticed the water tastes better after boiled in the kettle. The kettle also does a wonderful job for preserving the heat, and that is very important for me as a loose tea love. I would definitely recommend it. But there were moments when I felt I had to be careful with the kettle as it is glass.

reviews.reviewTitle: Keep it dry when not in use
reviews.reviewText: Looks attractive on the countertop. Fun to watch it come to a roiling boil with the blue light on.  Easy start, just flip the switch on the side.  The light goes off after the water has boiled a bit.  After the second use, the bottom got black splotches, even though I dried it after using it (the lid doesn’t open all the way so it’s hard to get a tea towel in to dry it).  Not sure if that’s a sign of a lesser quality stainless, but will keep an eye on it in case it develops pits or cracks.  When filled to capacity, it still boils in a reasonable time.  The kettle is new to me and I really hope it lasts because I think I’m kinda falling in love with it!

I bought this kettle based on the recommendation of a friend, and we love it.  It’s large enough to handle our family’s needs — or my tea habit...lol...and looks nice enough to leave out all the time.  Water boils quickly, it is easy to clean, and I like the fact that the kettle is glass.

"I have been looking for a tea kettle for my husband for over a year now.  He insists that it needed to whistle in order to prevent him from forgetting about it.  I insisted on a glass carafe as I like the clean nature of the beverage made in glass over metal kettles.  When I purchased this kettle for him, he was  a bit skeptical but soon was won over by the quick heat up time and the automatic shut off.  We love the kettle and it doesnt hurt that it is attractive enough to leave on the counter all the time."
Convenient for college student dorm life; good looking. Good after sales service, registered for 2-year warranty just in case anything goes wrong with the kettle.

I have not used it yet other than to boil some water to clean the kettle. It boiled water but did not switch off automatically. I did it manually, and then turned it back to boiling being gentler with the lever and it turned off by itself. I’m not adding stars because I can’t yet comment. This is the reason for odd stars. I wish I did not have to do the star thing yet... barely had it, I have now used it several times and do not have an issue with it automatically switch off once the water boils. It’s a great electric kettle

reviews.reviewTitle: Not the best kettle, just ok
reviews.reviewText: "I have been through many sorts of kettles. I bought this one because it was glass and i wanted to avoid those mineral deposit and hard water stains that typically show on the stainless steel ones. This also had a nice big top that I anticipated would be great for filling and cleaning. After using this, I have to say that there were brown spots on the bottom of the kettle immediately after using it the first time. They didnt go away after trying to clean. The kettle takes a long while to auto shut off and shakes when the water is really boiling. I did love the glass and i do love the size of the lid, but its not the best kettle Ive owned. It does the job."

"Im very happy with this electric kettle. I wanted something without plastic, and this seemed the best choice. The only plastic (BPA free) that comes into contact with the water is the filter that is attached to the lid and rests in front of the spout. If you dont want water to pass through any plastic when pouring, just open the lid. Simple. Otherwise, you could just break off that filter part. If you have hard water and get mineral deposits on the bottom of the kettle, just put in a bit of white vinegar, let it sit, then rinse it out. Easy!"

"The new kettle is lovely, I like the shape, different than many of the others. Press-a-button easy to use. There seems to be a click like its turning itself off when just turned on, but as its working fine, not sure what the sound is.", "I didnt interact with customer service, but they have followed up with information about de-scaling (as encouragement to write a review, but its still good information to have)."

For starters, I have been trying to decide on an electronic kettle for a while. My sister has been trying to talk me into getting one but I wanted to find a brand that I could trust. I wanted one that would be easy to use and clean., Found it!, It is easy to clean. From start to finish, it only took about 4 minutes to have perfectly temped water., Something that I want to point out, if you are looking boil a large volume of water and want it to stay hot for a long time, this may not be for you. This is a glass carafe, you will need to look for something that is insulated., For my needs, this is perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: My favorite water boiler so far
reviews.reviewText: I am very pleased with this product.  I have used multiple electric kettles before and this one is so far my favorite. You need to clean your water boilers with water and vinegar to clean out the mineral deposit (calcium) at the bottom. The plastic smell is just the smell of new product materials. Mine went away after I cleaned it with a couple water boils.  I really like the stainless steel on the lid where the steam reaches.  Other water boilers that just have plastic will eventually crumble.  The water boils in all glass and the only plastic that touches the water is the screen frame at the spout. Love the button that opens the top for easy refill and pour. Others I used flop around. And of course the blue light makes it fun!

"I wanted to buy my brother and his wife a kettle for Christmas because they are big tea drinkers. I was looking at traditional kettles and nothing struck me as being too exciting. Most looked like they would be in a grandmas house and they were only big enough to make 2-4 cups of tea. When I stumbled across this, I immediately loved the high tech and clean look of it so I thought Id give it a shot. Needless to say, they love it! It looks awesome, heats up quickly and holds A LOT of water. After plugging it in and filling it with water, it was rapidly boiling after just a few minutes. Definitely worth the price and Im happy with my purchase"

Hello,, I like it, very nice n easy to clean. Just use it, and I saw some dark spots on the bottom, I wonder if someone else has reported the same issue, it looks old with the spots, I already tryied to clean them but no luck yet., The spots are on the bottom, on the aluminum plate, just let me know if they’re normal, or should I buy another brand., I want nothing toxic or to put my family in danger?, Thanks for your help,, Maurice Mayora St

"we have a stainless tea kettle now and after a few years of use, find a fishy taste in our tea.  we have cleaned it accordingly but still find there is a small aftertaste that is not refreshing after a few weeks again so we went with the Glass Kettle.  so far, its working very well."

reviews.reviewTitle: Cosori electric kettle a good purchase
reviews.reviewText: We really like the Cosori 1.7L electric kettle.  It is both functional and elegant in appearance.  We love the clean, glass look and the blue light around the rim as it heats up.  It heats water rapidly (and not nearly as noisy as our old one), turns off after it attains a boiling temperature.  Highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just what I was looking for!
reviews.reviewText: "Feels really well made. The lid locks so that you dont get splashed.  The water will glow blue when the unit is on, and when the water comes to a boil the kettle will shut itself off and the light will go out to let you know that it.s ready. I drink a lot of tea and this is way better than heating water up on the stove or waiting for water to boil in the microwave.", Not to mention its much much faster.  I liked this so much I purchased a couple for gifts, and paired it with some nice teas for my friends.

This is my first electric kettle, so I have nothing with which to compare it, but it works pretty much as I expected., "Operation is pretty self-explanatory. The kettle might be a little loud, and a tone when its done could be helpful, but those are little things. The only thing I find annoying is the lid. It only opens partway, which makes it so the kettle wont fit under the water dispenser in my fridge. The lid also blocks the opening enough that its hard to stick my hand down in the kettle when I clean it.", "Other than that, my tea is hot and my kids are excited about making their own instant oatmeal, so Im good."

"I drink a lot of tea and mainly bought this to use while camping so as not to have to use our propane stove as much.  I find myself wanting to use this at home too instead of the tea kettle.  I like that the water heats up quickly and there is no plastic where the water resides.  I like that it shuts off by itself.  It s a nice design that looks good on the counter too."

I bought this when my previous electric kettle died. I was looking for a stainless steel one, but this one looked cool, so I decided to try it. I thought this kettle would be heavier than a plastic kettle because it was glass, but surprisingly it wasn’t that much heavier. The cord is about 36 inches long. I wish it was a bit longer, but it’s not really a problem. Any longer it could be messy. There really isn’t anything special about all electric kettles. They boil water, and this one does the job.

I could have bought cheaper ones (and I had indeed got a few cheaper ones before), but I wanted to have a quality one. This one satisfies me in all areas. Looks cleaning, easy to use, very fast to boil the water even at the maximum level. In addition, the seller/manufacturer appeared to be very good in their customer service. So far so good. I was so satisfied with this kettle that I bought another Cosori product (pressure cooker).

reviews.reviewTitle: Waste of money, design of the lid and filter is a pain
reviews.reviewText: I bought this last month, within a month, it was broken., "The filter is attached on the lid with a delicate plastic part, and the plastic part breaks so easily. Tbh I dont have any problem using a kettle without filter, but this one is different. with out the filter, the LID DOES NOT CLOSE. So I requested a replacement, still having faith in the product.", "Second one was good for two weeks until the plastic part breaks and the filter falls off. Two kettles, brand new, with same exact problem. Its not quality problem, its a design problem.", I ended up buying another kettle from other brand and requested a refund. This experience was so frustrating I just want my money back :(

reviews.reviewTitle: Unplugging as opposed to turning off
reviews.reviewText: I am very annoyed by having to unplug, as opposed to turning it off, between uses.  It makes it look sloppy, on smaller counter-tops, like those apartment dwellers have.  It is also counter-intuitive and hard to remember.  Turning things off the s natural,  for example when I saw this email, I had to get up and pull it out, realizing I hadn’t. There’s also a great difference between something being perfect you’re not perfect and this would be absolutely perfect if it wasn’t for that factor.  I was so excited about all the other features. Another thing is that most children or adolescents will not remember to pull it out since it is the only thing they have to do that with.,

"I have waited to write this review as I wanted to use it for several months before reviewing.  This kettle heats well and is attractive but it is super high maintenance and I wouldnt buy it again if I had too!  It is huge - much larger than I need but I bought it because I am trying so hard to rid my life of plastic.  Problem number 1, there is minimal plastic located at the spout that touches water so I have to open the top to pour the water out.  Problem number 2 is it is hard to clean, the top cover is small and only opens 3/4 of the way - it is hard to get an arm inside to clean.  Which leads me to the most problematic problem.  I have fairly good water and dont have any trouble with spots (hard or soft water) elsewhere in my home but if I use my tap water it scours the bottom stainless steel surface.  Since it spots easily and is hard to clean I use distilled water only.  We can put a man on the moon but apparently we cannot make a non-plastic, small easy to keep and clean water kettle!!!"

reviews.reviewTitle: Stinks of Glue Odor--Returned to Amazon
reviews.reviewText: "Out of the box, unused and brand new, this kettle stunk of highly toxic airplane glue. This stink was probably caused by the gluing of the glass housing to its stainless steel base. Ive owned kettles of this kind that did not have this stink upon viewing the product out of the box. One wonders who runs a company like this and whether quality control and safety inspections are done! But hey, if a smell like this accompanies an item through which you will be ingesting its water, well, do I really have to comment further about how dangerous a product like this can be for your health? Only someone completely unconscious and stupid would not remark on this this kind of issue, and apparently there are quite a few characters like this, who gave this crappy product a 4 or 5 star rating. If you like the smell of toxic glue you will love this product! I returned it directly to Amazon. Smells of this sort are often associated with causing respiratory difficulties, brain fog and cancer. This product should be removed from the market due to its health dangers! I hope Amazon reads this review and acts responsibly."

The design and appearance of this kettle are both very good.  The on/off toggle switch is just easy to operate, as is the lid release button.  The LED lights are very cool.  Obviously I do not know what the durability will be like; from experience though, the lid release catch of kettles tends to be the first thing to go wrong.  Time will tell with this one.  Right now I am pleased with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic smell and spots on heating disk
reviews.reviewText: The kettle looks and feels nice; the lid is easier to close/open than on our previous kettle; LED indicator looks cool., However, there is plastic smell from the inside of the kettle even after boiling fresh water 5 times., Also, spots revealed on the heating disk after the first use., Strangely, instruction manual says to wash the kettle with soapy water after _every_ use,, "which doesnt make sense."
Has plastic touching the water, not shown in picture

I don’t think I can say enough glowing things about this kettle. It’s glass so it heats fast, holds the heat (doesn’t dissipate quickly) and as it’s glass, BPA free for bringing water to a boil. I use it primarily for making kombucha, but have started using it for my French press coffee, soups, boiling water to cook pasta and vegetables much faster - in short, finding many uses for it! I love the LED lights, not only does it let you know when the water temperature is perfect by shutting off, but the lights are aesthetically pleasing as well. Best kettle I’ve ever had - and no searching for the stovetop trivet 😉

reviews.reviewTitle: Everything I wanted in an electric kettle
reviews.reviewText: A lot of thought and care went into designing this kettle. It has an extremely wide opening at the top for easy filling and cleaning. The only materials that ever touch water are borosilicate glass and stainless steel. The lights in the base act as a glaringly obvious "this is probably hot" warning, while also looking good. The carafe is very attractive and should be quite durable considering its material. My only complaints are that I wish the heating element turned off just a little bit quicker after the water comes to a boil, and the base that the carafe sits on could be a little heavier. But those are just me being picky in an attempt to find things to be critical about :)

reviews.reviewTitle: "A very worthy replacement for my 7-year-old Chefs Choice Kettle"
reviews.reviewText: I like almost everything about the Cosori Electric Glass Kettle. I have one small concern about its quality/reliability which I will mention first, then will proceed to tell what I like about it., "After boiling only 3 or 4 pots of water, there is a considerable amount of scale on its interior stainless steel bottom see left-hand photo below. Ive also included a picture of the interior of my old pot that hasnt been de-scaled for six weeks or more middle photo. The Cosori has significantly more scale than the old Chefs Choice. I feel confident that a de-scaling will remove the spots, but Im wondering why are they building up so quickly?  I hope this isnt an indicator of a short life span ahead.", Now the good stuff:, "1) Its very attractive. A main reason that Im replacing my good old kettle is because, although it still works well, it is beginning to look very shabby. The Cosori really adds class to my coffee prep area. I like the blue LED lighting as well.", "2) It has a glass pot. This allows me to see when the water is approaching a boil, but not quite boiling. I like to brew my coffee at about 200°F. With my old kettle I had to keep opening the lid to peer in to see if it was getting close to boiling. Also the glass pot makes it very easy to see the water level when Im filling it, rather than squinting at the old pots sight glass.", "3) Its slimmer than the old kettle and doesnt take up quite as much counter space. Although it looks taller than the old one, overall it actually is not.", 4) It may be healthier. Other than a necessary gasket of some kind (probably silicone) that seals the glass pot to the stainless steel bottom, no plastic contacts the boiling water., " 5) There are hundreds of satisfied customers reviews on Amazon. This helps give me confidence that my purchase was a wise one.", 6) It has a 2-year warranty. Many similar products have only a year or less., 7) It cost considerably less than my old pot did seven years ago., If this Cosori kettle lasts anywhere near as long as my old one, I will be very happy.

Attractive, after receiving I questioned the need for the kettle. For my purposes the microwave is more useful. Many Items such as Non-instant oatmeal, or anything that needs cooking cannot be done with water boiled in this kettle. I find it somewhat difficult to remove the kettle from the base. I think the blue light that comes on when turning on the kettle should turn red or green when the water is boiled.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great eletric kettle that blows away the competition.
reviews.reviewText: So far I am loving this electric kettle. This after several competiitors! Heats up quickly and I really appreciate the wide rim so that I can properly stick my hand in afterward for proper cleaning. Thank you and keep up the great work. I will certainly consider your products in future purchases. I will also recommend to anyone on the fence. This is a quality made product that should be considered when research to purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: POOR QUALITY, PERMANENT STAINS AFTER 10 USES
reviews.reviewText: Work well the first two times, then went vacation for a week. Resumed using daily after returning home and DARK WATER STAIN begin to develop after 2 more daily use. I tried to rub a stainless steel cleaner on it with some improvement but those dark spots seem to be permanent. The dark spots on the stainless steel bottom is getting worse after 3 more use. Now I am really CONCERNED with the longevity of this product. Don’t understand where all the positive reviews coming from. Had a competing product named Ovente and that lasted 3 plus years. That one started to developer similar stains after 3 years but I was able to clean that off with a stainless steel cleaner. Maybe I should go back to that one.  VERY DISSAPPOINTING PURCHASE.

I just received this product in the mail. I opened immediately to clean and test it., Packaging:, Packaging was no frills (I consider that a bonus). Two pieces of styrofoam (top and bottom) with a manual, thank you card with warranty information, and some plastic bags containing the key items (Base and Pot). The packaging was stout and more than sufficient considering I heard my mailman literally throw the amazon box at my door from around 5-6 feet away. Nothing was broken or even looked jostled., Cleaning:, "I do not have small hands, so I was concerned about being able to reach within the pot for proper cleaning. This was quickly dashed as I was able to reach inside very easily. There are very few nooks and crannies that can harbor anything bad as well. The cleaning process was quick and painless and the pot dried easily. My only complaint is being unable to leave it upside-down to drain any excess liquid out (the lid doesnt move out of the way). This is a minor complaint and a personal preference, so I did not remove any stars for this.", Use:, "Once dried, I filled the pot to just a bit above the max line (wasnt paying attention). I do not recommend going any bit past that line if at all possible, as when the water came to a boil it was nearly reaching the spout. Nothing spilled out, but if you ignore the lines you will have a mess on your hands. I placed the pot, once filled, on the stand and watched it boil up, which took around 7 minutes or so. During that I touched multiple surfaces to see the heat distribution, as I want to place this somewhere slightly more delicate than my kitchen counters.", "The base of the pot was just the tiniest bit warm. Not by any means a danger to any surface, and I was rather impressed by how little heat it actually held. The metal surfaces at the top and bottom were both warm to the touch, but far removed from burning skin, and probably somewhat comfortable on a cool or cold day. The glass was hot to the touch and will burn you, as expected. This is not a product to leave where children can reach it or pull it down, as itll cause burns and possibly cuts if the glass breaks. But I feel confident on placing it on any surface within my house and it wont cause any damage.", Pros:, "Relatively quick to boil. Quite easy to clean. Nice blue LED to tell when its on and when boil is reached itll auto-shut off within around 30 seconds (my timing). Was able to move the pot freely around on the stand and it worked no matter the direction.", Cons:, "No water temperature control. This was my only complaint, as I dont like tea as hot as most do (especially compared to my European friends). It provides a nice heat and is an appropriate temperature for me, but being able to adjust this would be nice. This was my one star removal.", Notes:, This is my first electric pot, so I do not know if other pots have temperature controls. If not, what are they waiting for? (safety concerns maybe?), I rated this at 4 stars due to being a new owner and not knowing its lasting legacy as of yet, and the temperature control. As of this time (14 Sep 2019) I consider it a 5 star pot for my own needs and desires. In time I will probably come back and adjust the review accordingly.

**** THIS IS AN UPDATE TO THE INITIAL REVIEW ****, "I initially reviewed this product as a one star product because it leaked. Upon further use, Ive found that the leakage was caused by a user error. Weve been brewing Korean roasted corn tea in the kettle but this caused the water to foam, bubble and then overflow. We tried it without the roasted corn in it and didnt overflow. This product is sleek, looks nice on my counter and does exactly what its supposed to do.", The kettle does what it’s supposed to do, looks nice sitting on my counter but the only thing is it leaks two or three drops. The second day I used it, leaked about a quarter of the contents from the base of the kettle.

"We love the look, the capacity, and how quickly water boils in this kettle. I especially appreciate how easy it is to clean. Yes, minerals build up on the bottom and, yes, that happens in all tea kettles unless, of course, you have reverse osmosis in your water supply. Having come from a home with a well and extremely hard water, it was always a chore to clean up my metal tea kettle. Now that were in a new apartment, there are fewer mineral deposits in our water, but they still build up every day. Because this has such a wide top, its easy to clean with a little white vinegar and water, which I do on a daily basis since Im quite anal! The manual addresses this but I dont use nearly the amount of vinegar they suggest. My picture shows the kettle boiling water for another coffee thermos.We couldnt be happier with this product."

This was a Christmas gift for my friend, a serious tea drinker. Never having found an electric tea kettle that she liked, she kept buying stove top kettles, Generally she would leave the whistle off so as not to disturb the neighbors, forgetting them and leaving them on the stove too long and burning them up... Christmas today, she LOVES her new COSORI glass kettle, 5stars+  Beyond happy!!! Heats the water in minutes, easy to clean, auto shut off.... AND she loves the blue light in the pot...Definitely recommend

I specifically bought this kettle because it said it didn\t have plastic in it. The lid and hinge have plastic, so when the water boils it condenses there and drips back down. It also has a nonremovable plastic filter that the tea pours through. "BPA free" or not, I am not interested in having plastic tea, so I\m returning it. Otherwise, seemed ok. It has a kind of cheap feeling, but it is a lot bigger than other kettles, so that\s a pro.

We drink A LOT of tea when watching television, It i far more convenient to have a thermal pot of hot water nearby than get up for a new cup of hot water. We use this to heat our water, then empty into a thermal pitcher. Heats water to boiling quickly, an automatically shuts of. Having a glass vessel instead of a metal one is very handy. It is easy to see anything building up inside the vessel on sides or bottom, and requires cleaning. White vinegar sitting for a few minutes cleans the pot well. We had dinner guests, and they went home and ordered the same unit after seeing ours operate.

reviews.reviewTitle: Kitchen not complete without an electric tea kettle
reviews.reviewText: Our tea kettles get used every day and this tea kettle is a nice addition to our appliances. I would have stuck with my last brand but it had been changed slightly and the reviews were not as good. I researched this tea kettle and decided to purchase it. I feel it heats the water faster than the previous kettle (which was around 4 years old). It cleans beautifully. Every few weeks I heat a pot of water with 1/4 cup vinegar and the glass sparkles like new.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful but a bit slow to boil
reviews.reviewText: "I like this kettle very much -- the style matches my kitchen decor perfectly and the customer service is great (friendly followup email from the company offering helpful tips, though they were already in the instructions). However Im a bit disappointed by how long it takes to boil. My previous kettle heated about twice as fast. Not sure if this will be a deal breaker; Im still trying to decide because I REALLY like the kettle and feel like I may get used to waiting a few extra minutes. Its very nicely made also."

I bought this because of the glass pitcher.  One thing I noticed compared to my old electric kettle is that if this one is left unattended, the water will stay at a hard boil for at least a minute before the pitcher shuts off.  My old kettle would shut off as soon as the water came to a boil., "The other problem is mineral scaling on the metal base. I didnt notice the problem with my old kettle, but it was opaque plastic, so maybe I just couldnt see the scale as easily?  Its actually very easy to clean the mineral scale by boiling some diluted vinegar in the kettle and the very wide mouth makes it easy to clean, so overall not a problem."

"We use this for EVERYTHING now. Love the blue light. My husband turns off all the lights at night when we have company to show the blue light. LOL! Heats pretty quickly. Love that its glass and we dont have to use the microwave. We use this for top ramen and hot cocoa too. Mostly coffee."

I bought this because I needed a kettle with hotter water then my Keurig. I wanted HOT coffee. I needed boiling water to dissolved medications. This works perfect. It boils water in about 3.5 minutes. I love the method of electric as it has a base as opposed to having a cord attached directly to the pot. You simply set the glass kettle on the base, hit the little button just below the handle, and wella. It lights up so you know its on. It shuts off after a bit so if you walk away it wont burn down your house. You dont have to drag a cable when you pour as older models have. All in all a good purchase. (This is an honest review and is in no way solicited by the company), I have yet to find anything negative about it. I will update if I do. But for now highly recommend this product.

After a little over a month of use I noticed I had to keep pressing the switch down for it to turn on because the switch would randomly move to the off position. Now 4 months later the switch wont stay down in order for the water to boil. And of course I missed the return window.

"I bought this for my girlfriend who makes tea all the time. She really likes it! I noticed it boils water very fast, and it is probably the most aesthetically attractive electric kettle Ive seen.", "The only thing its missing which I noticed some kettles have, is a temperature control for specific types of tea.. Apparently it is good to have the temperature set differently for different types of tea, but I wouldnt know the difference. All the tea Ive made with this has tasted great. Its also very easy to clean"

I wanted to try another COSORI product because I have their air fryer which is great.  I wanted an electric kettle because we make a lot of tea and could use it in other ways in the kitchen.  The blue light when it heats up is beautiful and I wanted clear glass so I could see the water (preference) nice and sturdy.  The only thing I do not like and it’s disappointing because it’s great otherwise.  It’s very loud when it’s heating up it’s very noisy.  I’ll use it but the next one I get I’ll make sure to check the operating sounds in the feedback.

"I really like the performance of the kettle but I didnt realize until I got it how terribly hard it is to add water. The lid doesnt open enough to pour it in from a pitcher and I dont use the tap so its really hard."

Second type of electric kettle I have purchased.  This time around I bought this one because I could actually reach into it to clean it (some competitors have smaller lids and you cant reach in to clean.  This one you can., ONLY thing I wish it did, was the top came off so I could use it directly with my fridge water dispenser.  this and many others do not fit under the fridge door spout so I have to use another container and transfer from fridge to kettle., "On/off lever is in a funky place, at the base of the handle.  Seems like it may be the first thing to break accidentally hitting it with something, but well see.", Overall, it sure beats boiling water on the stove or tea kettle.  Much more energy efficient.  Some reports I have read say these save up to 30% energy over heating a stove burner and a pot.

"I could not be more pleased with this electric water kettle. It is fast and extremely well made. My main concern was finding one without anything but glass touching the water and although the lid has a little bit of it, I open it up to pour so that I dont use the strainer with the plastic around it. I also keep the lid open after the boil so the heat does not cause anymore condensation on the plastic and drip into the water. All in all, I am extremely surprised I found this nice of a kettle that met my requirements. The blue light is a great plus too turning on when boiling and off when it automatically turns off! Feel like stocking up on these would be the smart thing to do!"

"Replaced my stainless steel tea kettle with this and love it!  Its faster and safer - I can turn on the kettle, set up the cups with tea bags & honey, go do a couple other things in my nightly routine, come back to hot water ready to pour.  If I get sidetracked before coming back to the kitchen, I know once the kettle reaches the boiling point it automatically turns off.  I dont have to worry about accidentally letting the kettle get too hot, boil dry, or anything that would be unsafe.  Plus the Corsori Electric Kettle is WAY more attractive than my old stainless steel kettle!"

Well worth the money.  I love the size of the container, the look and the feel. I love the fact that the heating element is not inside with the water.  I also love the fact that it lifts off the base which can remain plugged in.  The mouth opens wide which makes it easy to clean and also makes it easy to refill.  There is a blue light at the base that turns on when heating and turns off when finished.  This makes it easy to know when the kettle is finished.  Mine stays on the counter and looks great.  I had not planned to leave it out on the counter but it is nice looking and I use it to heat water for everything from tea and coffee to water for vegetables it has quickly become a work horse in my kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buyer Beware if you have minerals in your water!
reviews.reviewText: The company suggested it is because of the minerals in my water that the kettle stained.  That I could clean it with vinegar or a lemon scrub.  Both suggestions were unsuccessful.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!  The kettle should have a warning about intended use - I was ripped off!  I cannot be the only one.

I use it to boil bottled water, so I do not have the calcium build up problems that others do. The glass is the only part that gets hot. The bottom metal ring, handle, bottom, and lid do not get hot. You can pour and place it where ever without worries of melting something. Base detaches from the pitcher with ease., Only way it can go bad, is if you clutter your area and the switch that you press down to start it, gets held down by something. This is the only way it will boil and stay on. Had it happen once, but luckily caught it just before it ran out of water., "After you pour all the water out, leave the lid open for a bit. Otherwise itll trap the humidity in and increase odds of bacteria. This is not the most likely thing, but something to consider if you only use it occasionally."

reviews.reviewTitle: Cosori Electric Kettle makes Tea Drinking Easy
reviews.reviewText: "This kettle makes boiling water very quickly and efficiently. It is incredibly easy to use. We use water from our filtered refrigerator and then turn it on. While the water is heating we get our tea bag or tea strainer ready the water is almost ready to go. The only reason for the four star rating is the manufacturers warning to unplug it so it doesnt short out from condensation under the base. Seems there should be a way to insulate the electronics with silicone or some other water impermeable substance to eliminate the need to unplug every time!"

reviews.reviewTitle: I Have Recieved a replacement and like it.
reviews.reviewText: I fear trhat the first Kettle shipped to me was defective.  I need help returning it to the manufacturer for their examination.  I have explained that I am careful and respectful of tools of all sorts. I recieved the replacement and have been using it.  The Primary Perfection of the design of this kettle is the ease of cleaning & level of thorough boiling it achieves.  While we should all be saving water whenever possible this kitchen tool brilliantly doubles as a kitchen counter waterheater for filling a sink with hot water for pot, pans or dishes. My whole house waterheater needs too much water flow to produce a quich hot water wash.  I think this should be a selling point for this COSORI Electric Kettle(BPA-Free),1.7L Cordless Glass Boiler Hot Water.  Please let the seller of the wonderful tool know that I am using it daily.  Please, Amazon Prime,  help me with a long overdue return shipping label.  This is my second request for this help.  Thank You, Kate Cesaretti

reviews.reviewTitle: I discovered a perfect way to clean it.  Plastic piece broke but kettle still works
reviews.reviewText: I bought COSORI Electric Kettle 9/18.  Box thrown out before I could fill out warrantee.  Plastic piece under lid broke within 2 months, but pot is still used 6-8 times daily.  I tried cleaning pot as directed in book.  Vinegar was not effective., Here is a better cleaner:  Boil .50L H20.  Add 1/2 cup Baking Soda.  Boil again.  Add .25L to the boiled water (to make .75L).  Add 1/4 more Baking Soda.  Boil again.  Rince.  You now have a brand new pot!  I recommend this kettle but please send in the warrantee.  The plastic is bound to break.  One year and the kettle is the most used device in the kitchen.............

reviews.reviewTitle: Why does it boil so long?
reviews.reviewText: "I really like this kettle and decided to keep it. 95% of the time Im boiling enough water for one cup of tea so I only put the water to the minimum level mark, but nice to have a large container if I have company or want to get water hot for soup.", "Dont understand why it boils the water so long before shutting off?  My old kettle clicked off right after the water came to a boil.  Dont think its preferential for tea to have water that has been boiling 30 seconds.", Other than that, it is nice looking, fun blue light on the base when it is on, no plastic touches the water

I followed instruction and boiled water for first time. After pouring the water out, there were stains on the bottom of the kettle and the glass of the kettle was steamed. I’m not prepared to use 4 cups of vinegar after every use to clean the stains. I was very disappointed with the product especially after reading some glowing reports.

Safety features got a 4 star rating, need to remember that the glass is very hot so keep away from children. We decided to go with glass instead of plastic health/safety reasons, plus with a new grand baby were not using water from a plastic bottle ( landfills ) is so full here find that boiling water for drinking is best for us. Still, a very good product, Aloha from Honolulu Hawaii. P S, get the insurance!

reviews.reviewTitle: Safer than traditional tea kettle - good for someone with a disability
reviews.reviewText: "I mistakenly burned my old tea kettle due to forgetting that it was on once, then turning it on and not realizing that there was no water in it. It charred and the handle burned, so was unsafe to use. The kettle I replaced it with, unfortunately, kept scalding my hand when I poured, and then I injured my hand trying to remove the lid which was very tight.  This Cosori Electric Glass Kettle has solved these problems. I can see how much water is in the kettle, it turns off when it gets to a rolling boil, its easy to pour, easy to clean.  As someone with a disability, I feel that this was not a frivolous purchase, but a necessary one. Oh, I forgot to mention that it boils FAST!"

"My family is full of tea drinkers but weve always used a stovetop kettle to boil water. Bought this for Christmas and its even better than I anticipated. The water boils so fast and stays super hot for a long time so we can keep making tea without needing to reboil. The kettle is also very pretty, and I love the blue light it has when heating up. Its very easy to handle and to clean. Overall a great purchase, were all very pleased!"

When my T-Fal kettle died after 14 years of service the hunt was on for a new one. I tried several different kettles, which failed within months of purchase, so I took a chance on this Cosori kettle and so far so good. It heats water fast and looks especially fabulous with the blue light that turns on when the kettle is on. I’m using distilled water in it so as not to have to deal with sediment and de-scaling. My only concern is the flimsiness of the base. It is hollow and super light weight, which has me wondering how long it will last. If it fails I’ll be sure to return and update this review. Fingers crossed!

reviews.reviewTitle: I hate writing critical review BUT ...
reviews.reviewText: This kettle is not so good because: (1) I cannot use both AC and this kettle and every time I start heating water for several minutes, the AC will down; (2) There are many stains (CANNOT CLEAN) in the bottom of the kettle; (3) You have to wash the kettle very often or the boiled water could be yellow., "So, I dont recommend this kettle."

I had very high expectations for this kettle. I used it to make boiling hot water for my coffee., Unfortunately after about 20 uses, it started to spot. I had dried the kettle religiously with a dry rag after every single use, so it was disappointing.

I like the wide opening on the lid and the kettle is attractive, especially when in use and it lights up! I have had no problems with it boiling a minimum level of water or a full pot. With the water I currently have, there is no mineral build-up, but in previous places I lived with hard water I would get white mineral build up in my glass kettle. This was easily fixed by filling the kettle to maximum level with a mixture of water and vinegar and boiling it. Removed all mineral deposits and the kettle looked brand new afterwards!

"I ordered this model rather than more complicated ones with temperature control, etc. because the more features they have the easier they break. After all what do you need from tea kettle? To boil enough water fast. And this one does indeed! It works perfectly, it has this substantial heavy weight to it that you wont get with plastic appliances, and it looks great. Very happy!"

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t waste your money! not a good kettle
reviews.reviewText: Expensive but not a durable electrical kettle!!! The first one I received from Amazon was previously broken, so I had to exchange for another one. The second one I got lasted only four months! The lid got stuck upright. I tried to close it by pushing down the lid (maybe too forcefully?) and broke the lid from the kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Reliable, easy to use and beautiful design
reviews.reviewText: "I bought this kettle after I burned my stove top version (oops) and it couldnt have come at a better time since I was struck a sore throat and cold the day after it arrived and have been using it non-stop. It was very easy to clean and it works fantastically, I used 7 times alone yesterday and have had no problems, whatsoever. Fantastic product, fantastic price and am I the only one that likes to watch the water boil? Its gorgeous!"

reviews.reviewTitle: How did I live without one?!!!
reviews.reviewText: "I have only been using this kettle for a few weeks but so far it is wonderful!!! I cannot speak yet to durability but it is very easy to use and clean etc.  The water boils before you can turn around and I use it for tea other hot drink and when I cook for things that need hot water.  I have always used a kettle on the stove but never found one that was very good no matter what the $$$.  A friend had an electric kettle which I had never thought about getting....neither did she until receiving it as a gift.  Now I dont know how I managed all these years without one!!!  I will never go back to a stove kettle!!!  I love the blue light to show it is on and the automatic turn off...in case I get distracted which happens!!!  So so far....all good comments."
I loved, easy to use great product, I use it everyday heating is fast less then 5 minutes, I knew I can trust cosori products, I recommend this product,  thank you cosori.

"Weve had this kettle for nearly 6 months now. And use it usually at least once a day.  It has performed well, no complaints! Still looks nice!", "When I first received it I did the vinegar boil. Weve had no trouble with rust, theres been build up of course, but we do use filtered fridge water.", Pictures: one of 5+ months deposit build up... life gets crazy! The second, about ten minutes later, after a vinegar boil and a paper towel wipe! Like new! The wide mouth does make it easy to clean well.

Did you see what I did there? I am so clever. However, what\s even more clever is this li\l Electric Kettle. I love being able to see the water starting to boil, and since it lives on the counter, not having another Stainless Steel Thing laying about is a nice touch. It "blends in" a little better as you can see through it. And it has a cool blue light! Who doesn\t want that? More importantly, it heats efficiently, keeps hot, and I use it not just for tea, but for heating water for stocks and blanching, as it\s faster than the microwave.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not overfill, seriously. The water needs the additional room to roll around in the kettle.
reviews.reviewText: I only had this kettle for less than a week so this review is not trustworthy when it comes to durability. I will come back to provide updates if it did not last. Other than that, I like the design, I think it is a good product. Easy to use and clean as long as you follow the instructions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Oustanding Electric Kettle! Fantastic Customer Service!
reviews.reviewText: "Prior to purchasing this kettle, I did a ton of research. I dont like purchasing cheaply made products (at cheap prices) only to have them last 2 years. This is a great kettle. Heats up super fast. Great design, so you can leave it out on your kitchen counter. But the best part is Cosoris Customer Service. I called before purchasing to ask a few questions. A lovely lady name Julia took my call. She was super knowledgeable and friendly.  So often I speak with customer service people who couldnt care less about you or the product. Julia was fantastic. Corsori... whatever youre paying her... its not enough!"

This attractive kettle is functional but care must be taken to avoid burning. The first time I used it, I popped open the top and boiling water drained down on my hand. I previously owned a Cuisinart which is no longer available on Amazon. Mine stopped working for no apparent reason. I liked the Cuisinart better because the water temperatures were adjustable. However, it was impossible to hand clean the Cuisinart because the opening was too narrow to insert my hand. The Cosori kettle has a wider opening and is easy to clean. Also, I like the glass better than metal. The instructions say to use a minimum of 2.1 cups of water for each usage. They also say to clean and dry after each use and to descale it with a solution of vinegar and water at least once a week if it is used frequently. This seems excessive to me. The warranty can be extended to two years if the product is registered within 2 weeks of purchase. The Cuisinart had a three-year warranty.

"I have had many electric kettles in the past.  I use an electric kettle every day.  This one has a very large water capacity that is more than enough to fill my tea pot.  Other kettles that I used, especially my last one, didnt pour the water out as nicely as this one.  All the boiling water easily pours where intended.  The kettle is sharp looking as works very well.  The water boils quickly.  I would buy again", Update:. I have had this for 10 months with daily use.  It still works great and looks great.  Fantastic product

"My old kettle, as faithful as it was, was looking pretty ragged.  Were moving into a new house soon, and I wanted a new pretty one.  So I did take it out of the box and examine it and do the water test, but then I boxed it up again until we move. lol  So we shall see if I still like it in a couple of months. :)", "It is very pretty, though, and the water came to a boil very fast.  I love the shut-off feature after it comes to a boil.  And I also love the blue light that comes on while boiling and then goes off when its done and the unit switches off."

reviews.reviewTitle: Mine is flawless - couldn’t be happier.
reviews.reviewText: Works great. No problems. Use it almost every day.  I don’t seem to have the spots the other person had, maybe it was a one off., It turns the water in to a roaring boil, super hot. I set it on a dining room table’s chair; no spills(even when filled past recommended quantity) no makes of any kind. Put it away, had it for a while with no need to wash it., I only put water in it. I use tap, my girlfriend uses filtered water.

Was a bit concerned it may discolor with water residue but so far so good.  For those trying to avoid plastic completely, there is a bit of plastic above the water line for the temperature sensor, and a bit holding the water filter in place that comes into contact with the water but only when poring., This kettle thoroughly boils the water before automatically switching off.  Great if you like tea made with truly boiling hot water, down side is it extends the boil time by nearly 15seconds.

It’s a beautiful kettle but I was EXTREMELY disappointed to find out about the silicone ring in the bottom!! After reading the description thoroughly with references to “no plastic” inside, I find it very upsetting that it has silicone, and it is misleading! Please CHANGE the description to include the silicone ring, or better yet redesign this beautiful product to exclude the ring- a full glass interior is what I am after., I will be returning, and I hope I get my return shipping refunded., Very disappointed customer.

"This teakettle is a beast. And it has a lovely blue LED to let you know that its on. But you really dont need that because when its on, its on. Within moments, youll see bubbles start forming and youll know that it wont be long until your tea is ready to be brewed. Honestly, best teakettle Ive had, partly because of the aesthetically pleasing blue light that does nothing but add to the high-tech-I-ness of it all."

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle - looks cool and works well.
reviews.reviewText: "I got neurotic one afternoon and wasted too much time trying to figure out the right kettle and wasted too much time trying to decide. I finally decided on this one, partly because it was cheap and if I didnt like it, I could justify buying a new one. I love it! I would buy it again. Its solid, looks cool when boiling water, and simple to use. Unless it gives out or something Ill be back but I would recommend if you got this far."

reviews.reviewTitle: Hands down the best kettle I have owned to date.
reviews.reviewText: "There is not one negative comment I can make about this product. I use this kettle for heating water for tea. Water boils very quickly. I love the fact that I can fit my entire hand in the kettle to clean it and wipe it out. Auto shutoff works as expected. The blue LED lights built into the bottom of the kettle definitely adds a cool factor to the product. I would not hesitate to purchase this product again although I dont believe I will need to. Also I think this kettle comes with a two year warranty ( Not positive about that though )"

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful easy to clean glass kettle
reviews.reviewText: Love this kettle! Much larger capacity than my old stainless steel one and so much easier to clean. It’s fully glass lined as described. It’s also just beautiful and fun to watch - the blue light and boiling is very lava lamp/disco :)

Noisy. Very loud. Wskes the baby. Thin and flimsy glass.  Leaks water from the bottom. Hard to clean. Lid does not open wide enough to clean inside. My other machine from another brand worked much better. See pics

It boils water. I am not convinced it is faster than a standard stove top tea kettle, I will have to race them and see who is better at it., "Other than that, it is easy, you hit a switch, water boils.. you make your tea.. on with your day. It would be nice if there was an optional bell or something to let me know when it is finished. Basically it gets hot and shuts off so.. If you are high and you forget that you have turned this on, you will have to go back in to the kitchen and turn it back on. I am not saying I am high.. I am just saying that is one of many possible scenarios. There is also the scenario that involves exploding underground dinosaur skulls, but I dont think that is necessarily relevant here."

"My new Corosi glass water kettle arrived a few days ago. Ive run the device through a few trial runs, and it works great so far. It feels sturdy and the included manual is obviously written by people who speak English first, a refreshing bonus in todays economy. The companys website allows for an extra years warranty by registering with them online. I did this and it was very quick and easy."

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, very easy to track the water level, easy to clean.
reviews.reviewText: I love the simplicity and the look,  the soothing fun blue light to indicate heating and the glass carafe. I bought a similar style of different brand and love it but took it to work where it is at home in my office so needed another at home. This came highly recommended so it went straight to work after a quick wash straight out of the box.

"* I would like to preface this review by stating that, after rabbit-hole research into these electric kettles, the offerings are generally far too big, volume-wise, for single household dwellers. 1.7L., 1.5L... I have never even needed 1.25L of water boiled at a time! A smaller version in the 1L capacity category would suit for many of us, Ill wager.*", "The Corsini 1.7L glass with stainless steel + plastic flip lid produces beyond-boiling hot water. Too hot. It is a steep then wait, wait, wait.... too hot kind of set temperature. Ive had a few electric kettles and none of those produced such seemingly excessive boilings. Not having a thermometer, Im unable to match my too-hot-to-drink-soon-in-a-reasonable-amount-of-time claim to Corsinis description of their boiling temperature but that is my 2¢. Spend the extra rabbit-hole time and expense to get a temperature-setting electric kettle. :("

reviews.reviewTitle: Lid broke after 4 months! Buy in a store not off Amazon
reviews.reviewText: Loved this kettle until after opening the lid one day it stuck open. Looks like it is jammed in the wrong spot. Water still boils but it stinks that I cannot close the lid or take it into a shop and exchange since I bought it at Amazon. 🙄

Started Leaking a little just after less than  a week of use and it leaks a pool of water after 2weeks., "Update: CS contacted me and sent me a free replacement for a 2nd chance and to make up with the inconvenience. The 2nd one arrived with both external box and internal one all beat up, but the pot survived. So far it is work fine for boiling up some water and havent leak yet. Updated from 1 star to 4 stars for a working unit."

We are very satisfied with this water boiler. We wanted something that minimized any plastic contact with the boiling water. Its a large size for those times you need a large pot of tea. Its quick enough. Easy to pour. Easy to wash. Simple to turn on and off. Have been using it for 5 months now with no problem. It does boil for a while before activating the auto shut off, but not more than 5 to 8 extra seconds.

I was really excited for this, and had it functioned as advertised it would have been everything i wanted. Unfortunately straight out of the box upon the first use, it leaked everywhere from the base where the bottom of the glass ends. Huge safety hazard and unusable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Takes quite a long time to heat water- UPDATE
reviews.reviewText: Love the look of this kettle, and it is easy to clean. It does however take way too long to reach a boil. Update- Cosori read my review and refunded me the cost of the kettle, without my asking. Very decent customer service and now not so annoyed by the time it takes to boil.

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid performance for an all-glass electric kettle
reviews.reviewText: This replaced a black plastic Krupps kettle that had lasted almost 10 years. Pros - large capacity, pretty fast heating, attractive, easy to clean.  One con - once it’s boiling it takes a surprisingly long time to automatically shut off -a at least 30 seconds at a full rolling boil. But - if you’re in nearby its easy to shut off., I hope it lasts as long as my old Krupps! At this point it’s been getting daily use for over six months.

So, I have only has this kettle for a few days. So, I cannot comment on durability, cleaning etc.,  As long as you do not have arthritis or other issues requiring normal strength, this kettle is great. It may be rather heavy for some owners. I love its capacity, and that the blue light shines if it is actively boiling. We drink a lot of hot tea in the mornings so the capacity is excellent. It looks nice. So far so good. Ask me the other questions in six months time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle and even better customer service
reviews.reviewText: I bought the Cosori kettle recently.  At first I had what I thought was a problem and contacted the Customer Service folks. They responded quickly, answered my questions and gave me some great information regarding the use of the kettle with hard water.  They could not have been more professional and customer orientated.  The kettle works very well, boiling water quickly and pretty quietly.  I would most certainly recommend Cosori to anyone who wanted an efficient kettle with a great customer service to answer any questions that they had.  Thank you Cosori for a great product and great people backing it up.

"I couldnt be happier with my new COSORI electric kettle.  Its a vast improvement over the last two Capresso electric kettles I owned.  For one thing, its sturdier built.  Ive only had it about two weeks, but I have used it several times a day since I got it.  Before retiring, I was a technical support manager for a large IT company, so I know a quality product when I see one."

reviews.reviewerName: Does not play well with others
reviews.reviewText: "I had a very similar kettle made out of ceramic. I kept chipping it every time I dinged it on the facet. For some reason the glass seems more durable in this regard. Its counter-intuitive but Ive dinged the glass more than a few times with no ill effect. My favorite feature is the automatic shut off. When a metal kettle on the stove is done you better attend to it or you risk a fire. I can go make my tea at my leisure with this kettle. Overall I love it."

When you order this product register it immediately to get your extra 1-year warranty. Also, to keep water spots off of the bottom use Vinegar almost daily. Just a small amount but never let it dry. Otherwise you will see some water spots which is only natural due to calcium from hard water which most of us have. Other than that, this product is "maybe" the best of it\s kind and the customer service is FANTASTIC!

Replaced a fully plastic kettle with this unit.  The whole inner base heats the water, so this is faster and more efficient than the old one, which had an exposed double loop element.  I like the automatic shut-off when you lift the kettle from the base - much less chance of accidentally boiling dry.  Handy blue indicator light when unit is operating; clear glass, so you always know how full it is at a glance.

"Been using this 3 times a day for 4 months. ITs great. Cleans easy. Has a good handle. Spout doesnt drip. It is a little on the heavy side. It boils the water super fast. Once it starts boiling it continues to boil for about a minute before it shuts off. You can be sure your water is totally boiled. I had the bente one which lasted 1 1/2 years and then it died. I notice some kind of staining above where the heating coils are. I filter my water but I suspect some kind of mineral is getting through. Taste is not affected by this."

We are very happy with our recent purchase of the glass electric kettle.  Being British an electric kettle is an important part of our every day tea drinking.  This boils fast, most important does not leak when we pour the water from the pot to the the tea pot.  It looks attractive on the counter.  There is no problem with a plastic taste at all, as I had read about in a few other reviews.  Order this and use it with confidence.

reviews.reviewTitle: "Looks good. Seems easy to clean. Got rid of new smell easily"
reviews.reviewText: Only just got this today, but a quick summary:, 1) It looks good., "2) There was a new smell. Easily got rid of it by washing and then boiling slightly soapy water in it a couple of times.", 3) Made tea in it using loose leaves - easier to get rid of the leaves than out of a teapot., "If it breaks or something goes wrong, Ill revisit this review, but so far, so good."

I received the kettle and started using several days. It is really good, the appearance is beautiful, the water is also very fast, the noise is not big, price is good with high quality, it is a happy online shopping. If you are a family, especially for children, you should choose this kind of trustworthy product. After all, if you drink it in your stomach, you need safety. It is better, it is still important for health.

This is the greatest kettle ever! It heats the water up super fast and shuts off if I can’t get to it right away! I work early hours so my family is sleeping when I am getting ready for my day. I love making tea or French press coffee in the morning and my old stovetop teakettle always managed to whistle up a storm when I was either in the bathroom or letting the dogs outside. The whistling would wake up my husband who is a light sleeper. So this is perfect! I also love the blue light! Great kettle for good price!

reviews.reviewTitle: Coolest Kettle but stopped working 4 mos later
reviews.reviewText: This kettle was a big hit in our house-- cool to watch boil and was quick on the job. 4 mos later, the kettle stopped working one day. It would stay "on" but the blue ring light that let you know it was working just stopped. Seems like the connection to heat conductor was lost . I just called customer service and they were very friendly and will be replacing my kettle. I\ll update once we have and hopefully the longevity on this was will be better and other was a fluke.

"I havent had very long so Im unable to know durability but everything else Im VERY IMPRESSED WITH!", I have very large hands and I can carefully clean the inside of the pot. I noticed signs of hard water so this will be my ONLY coffee pot! I also purchased a French Press pot to make coffee and loose leaf tea., Thank you for a great product., I hope other folks interested in this product will find it more than acceptable!!!

"I love this tea kettle. It heats the water super fast. It is easy to fill and to pour. Its easy to clean. It has a switch on the side that you flip to turn it on, and while it does not have a thermostat, because it is glass, it is very easy to just flip the switch to turn it off as soon as you can see that the water is starting to simmer (if you dont want it to boil for tea). I like the strainer that covers the pour spout to keep impurities out. And I love how it looks when it is heating with the glowing blue element around the bottom. It is attractive enough to leave out on the cabinet all the time."
